db:abstract.db:para: The QProxyStyle class is a convenience class that simplifies dynamically overriding QStyle elements.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A QProxyStyle wraps a QStyle (usually the default system style) for the purpose of dynamically overriding painting or other specific style behavior.

db:section.db:title: QProxyStyle::QProxyStyle(QStyle *style = nullptr)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QProxyStyle object for overriding behavior in the specified style, or in the default native style if style is not specified.
Ownership of style is transferred to QProxyStyle.

db:section.db:title: QProxyStyle::QProxyStyle(const QString &key)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QProxyStyle object for overriding behavior in the base style specified by style key, or in the current application style if the specified style key is unrecognized.

db:section.db:para: Destroys the QProxyStyle object.

db:section.db:title: QStyle *QProxyStyle::baseStyle() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the proxy base style object. If no base style is set on the proxy style, QProxyStyle will create an instance of the application style instead.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] int QProxyStyle::layoutSpacing(QSizePolicy::ControlType control1, QSizePolicy::ControlType control2, Qt::Orientation orientation, const QStyleOption *option = nullptr, const QWidget *widget = nullptr) const
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QCommonStyle::layoutSpacing(QSizePolicy::ControlType control1, QSizePolicy::ControlType control2, Qt::Orientation orientation, const QStyleOption *option, const QWidget *widget) const.

This slot is called by layoutSpacing() to determine the spacing that should be used between control1 and control2 in a layout. orientation specifies whether the controls are laid out side by side or stacked vertically. The option parameter can be used to pass extra information about the parent widget. The widget parameter is optional and can also be used if option is nullptr.
The default implementation returns -1.
